subject: The Long Wait Is Over!!!
event: No, no, not THAT long wait, sorry... The somewhat shorter long wait was the one I meant. The sixth and final issue of THE HARD CALL, our Wild Cards miniseries, is now on sale at your favoirte local comic book shop. Go out and snatch up your copy! Better yet, snatch up ten!!! Scripted by Daniel Abraham (author of THE LONG PRICE QUARTET and the forthcoming fantasy epic THE DAGGER AND THE COIN, and creator of Jonathan Hive), with art by Eric Battle, THE HARD CALL is an original tale of the Wild Cards universe, not an adaptation of a story from the books. The first five issues of the comic were published by DBPro, but with number six, Dynamite steps in to wrap up the tale. And for that other long wait... I'm working on it, I'm working on it.

comments.article: You did that on purpose. Should I send an invoice for my underwear?
comments.subject: Dammit George

comments.article:
AAAAAAAAAGHHHHHHHHHHH!!!!!!!!!!! Dammit.

Well, congrats to that shorter long wait all the same.

"And for that other long wait... I'm working on it, I'm working on it."
And we are waiting, we are sooo waiting :)

I'm looking forward to the nights, that would be half-sleepless just becasue I can't put down the book, just like I had with the previous books of the SoFaI.

comments.upictitle: Maiden of the Moon: moonlight serenade-Nene Thomas
comments.article:
LOL I think a lot of people will read the title and feel their hearts skip a beat or two, like mine just did!:p

Grats on the shorter long wait that's over, as for the long, long one...we are all with you on it,lol!:)

George, color me disappointed.  I don't mind that Dance isn't done because I want the best book possible.  I don't mind if you work on other projects, because you're an artist, this is the USA, and that is your absolute right. I'm happy your other projects are turning out well.   But don't mess with my head with a blog post titled like that.  Before reading down I excitedly thought Dance was done and started calling a few friends, until I read the rest of the post.  Do whatever you want with your creative life (by God you are one of my favorite writers of all time), but don't toy with emotions like that (unless its April Fool's Day)

Ah, c'mon... you started calling friends before you read even the FIRST SENTENCE of the post?

Without noticing the big cover image for HARD CALL?

This isn't a matter of life or death. Don't take it all so seriously. If I didn't joke around about this from time to time, I'd go mad.
Wow George, this post title is some form of cruel and unusual punishment...

Lol, I was totally analysing the post title before the rest of it loaded. 'Three exclamation marks? Would he announce Dance with three exclamation marks? Shouldn't there be more? No pun about winter or dragons? ... Dammit!'

I got my hopes up on that, even if only for a split second. The crash coming down was very hard.

Soon I hope to hear a great announcement, though this one is pretty good.
comments.subject: That was kind of mean...

comments.article: Nice. Good to see Daniel's last part of the series published, and that Dynamite's carrying through with getting these things sorted out.
I almost did a spit-take all over my computer. Made me laugh though. ^.^
comments.subject: ACKK!!!!

comments.article:
and because of this post topic and some others when you do post the real "THE LONG WAIT IS OVER" I will just think your teasing me again

but I will definitely be getting a few copies of the last hard call (two for me one for my dad and one for my sister)

and I know its a kind of soon but when will I be able to buy a hard back graphic novel of THE HARD CALL?

speaking of comics why cant
I get digital versions of all your comics? I want THE HEDGE KNIGHT, THE SWORN SWORD, THE HARD CALL, and FEVRE DREAM on my computer and phone. I have recently discovered that reading comics is more fun in digital format.

hell while i am whining about things i want what are the chances of getting audio versions of some of your older works like

Fevre Dream and Tuff Voaging and throw in some wild card books too :) you cant start with the reprint of WILD CARDS with the new stories and then just keep going from there ;)

sorry for the long post but I want all your works in every format I cant get.
comments.subject: thats just mean man

comments.article:
MR. MARTIN that's great that HARD CALLS is coming out! Of authors, Daniel Abraham is one of my favorites!

I am wondering why you are saying the wait was long, the WILD CARDS comic series came out timely I thought.
The 1st of the 6 issues was released April 9, 2008.  I believe that the series was meant to ship monthly, so it would have been scheduled to finish in October 2008.
comments.subject: Definitely not timely

comments.article: Wow, I definitely felt mine skip a few beats also.
Is there a plan to collect these issues into a single volume?  I was at my local comic shop this past weekend, and I honestly didn't even know Wild Cards existed in comic book form.
Yes, there will be a collected edition.

I've got to remove this blog's RSS feed from my Google homepage - I like seeing whenever a new post shows up but that headline almost gave me a heart attack until I clicked through and read the actual content.  What with the rumor that George wanted to be done with Dance before the Clarion workshop, and the hint about the July Gorilla in his calendar, and now a headline like this... not sure how much more my heart can take.
comments.subject: The anguish...

comments.article: I did the same thing...
comments.subject: Re: The anguish...

comments.article: Finally.  I've had the rest of this series in my To Be Filed box for ages.  :>

Ha ha ha ha ha ha ha! Funny, funny man! And, glad the war is over. I haven't read any of the wild card stories in any form. Going to my local comic shop tomorrow, as it happens, so I'll see if they've got this along with any of the older issues available. Thanks for the head's up!

I'm guessing that the appearance of dance is not imminent, cause after the draft has been completed, there will be rounds of edit/review to deal with, along with the physical aspect of getting the books designed, made and distributed. My guess would be sometime next summer at the earliest, and likely longer. Am I wrong in this?

Patience, people! Paul Masson (Orson Welles): "We will sell no wine before its time."
At last! I've been wondering when this story will get finished. Will be snagging this soon. I also want the trade too.

haha, oh man. when i scrolled down and read the title i KNEW that it was not "that" long wait. somehow i expect a whole different topic on the other wait. like a simple "It's done." or something ;)

greets
Evil, evil man.  :)
I have not read any Wild Cards, but that cover illustration is badass.
That was amusing.  I look forward to seeing the collected edition too.

I am a fan. I love your books and and am of those waiting, heart in hand, for the next in the Game of Thrones series. Though it is giving me high blood preassure to do it, I have managed to get myself to a zen place where I am willing to allow you as much time as you need to finish you book so it is execllent. (Magnanimous of me, no?) So please believe me when I say that the following responce to your post is said with the utmost respect and reverance for a writer I someday hope to be able to emulate in some small way:

You Bastard.
comments.subject: Worthy Sir

comments.article: Mr. Martin, imagine yourself driving a car with all of your fans crammed in the back seat: "Are we there yet? Are we there yet?" "I'm bored..." "Are we there yet?" "I have to pee...." "Are we there yet?" "STOP TOUCHING ME!!!" "Are we there yet?"
comments.subject: the long wait

comments.article: take as long as you need.we are waiting,i for myself have began to wait for TWOW too.
